input.sentences: while at the lake everybody had lunch . the kids ate macaroni .
while the adults ate fish they caught .
the kids put on life jackets before going swimming .
the adults rode in a canoe with some of the kids .
the adults almost flipped the canoe while paddling .
output.sentences: My children decided to eat macaroni and cheese for their lunch by the lake that day.
Even though our husbands had fish that they had caught and the rest of us ate, the kids didn't seem to want to try it.
After lunch, we all went swimming to enjoy our life with the kids.
My husband and I rode with the kids in the canoe to make sure the children didn't fall out of it.
However, it was in vain since as I was paddling, I accidentally leaned too far and flipped the canoe.
